body:
It seems py-astor is not compatible with latest (v41.4.0) py-setuptools, hence yielding build error. However, it builds just fine with earlier versions of py-setuptools.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install py-astor
...
    specifiers = [s.strip() for s in specifiers.split(",") if s.strip()]
AttributeError: 'SpecifierSet' object has no attribute 'split'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/mnt/local/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-skylake/gcc-7.4.0/python-2.7.16-xpjw43slye3gpenkpif4lzajlfpsj2b2/bin/python2.7' '
-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build'
See build log for details:
  /cache/sbulut/spack-stage/spack-stage-py-astor-0.8.0-4xsdi27ycyhhgeurnqui2f3e75yzjwqf/spack-build-out.txt
```
### Information on your system

- Centos7
- python@2.7.16
title: py-astor is not compatible with latest version of py-setuptools
